alert.note: Alert for Clay (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Clay and Leslie. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 436 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding of small streams and creeks, roads, and roadside culverts is expected. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roark, Queendale, Spring Creek, Skidmore, Creekville, Essie, Gardner, Marcum, Ashers Fork, Warbranch, Sandy Fork, Asher, Mozelle, Bobs Fork, Ice Cliff, Hoskinston, Stinnett, Bear Branch, Spruce Pine and Big Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
